    Class to hold a query schema

    • Method Detail

      • getSchemaName

        public java.lang.String getSchemaName()
        Returns the name of this schema.
        Returns:
        The schema name.

      • getDataSchemaName

        public java.lang.String getDataSchemaName()
        Returns the name of the data schema.

        This query is designed to be run over data described by this data schema.

        Returns:
        The data schema name.

      • getElementNames

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getElementNames()
        Returns the element names to include in the response.

        The element names are defined by the data schema associated with this query.

        Returns:
        The ordered list of query element names.

      • getSelectorName

        public java.lang.String getSelectorName()
        Returns the element name used as the selector.

        The element names are defined by the data schema associated with this query.

        Returns:
        The element names being selected.

      • getDataElementSize

        public int getDataElementSize()

      • getFilterTypeName

        public java.lang.String getFilterTypeName()
        Returns the name of the filter class for this query. The filter class name is the fully qualified name of a Java class that implements the DataFilter interface.
        Returns:
        The type name of the query filter, or null if there is no filter defined.

      • getFilteredElementNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getFilteredElementNames()
        Returns the set of element names on which to apply the filter.
        Returns:
        The possibly empty set of data schema element names.

      • getFilter

        public DataFilter getFilter()
        Returns the data element filter for this query.

        The data filter is applied to the getFilteredElementNames() data elements.

        Returns:
        The data filter, or null if no filter has been specified for this query.
